name: ListProjectInsights
description:
Retrieve insights list for a specific project.

This tool fetches insights data for a specified project from the Datadog API. Use it to track and log file system views with each GET request.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: Project ID to access specific insights. Obtain it via /api/projects/.

value_schema.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.

parameters.name: creator_user_id
parameters.description: The user ID of the creator of the insights. Provide this as an integer value to filter insights by the creator.

parameters.name: response_format
parameters.description: Specifies the format of the response, either 'csv' or 'json'. Choose based on your output preference.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the number of insights to return per page.

value_schema.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: results_offset_index
parameters.description: The starting index for returning results from the insights list.

value_schema.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

parameters.name: insights_refresh_mode
parameters.description: Determine how aggressively to refresh insights: 'force_cache', 'blocking', 'async', 'lazy_async', 'force_blocking', or 'force_async'.

value_schema.description:
Whether to refresh the retrieved insights, how aggresively, and if sync or async:
- `'force_cache'` - return cached data or a cache miss; always completes immediately as it never calculates
- `'blocking'` - calculate synchronously (returning only when the query is done), UNLESS there are very fresh results in the cache
- `'async'` - kick off background calculation (returning immediately with a query status), UNLESS there are very fresh results in the cache
- `'lazy_async'` - kick off background calculation, UNLESS there are somewhat fresh results in the cache
- `'force_blocking'` - calculate synchronously, even if fresh results are already cached
- `'force_async'` - kick off background calculation, even if fresh results are already cached
Background calculation can be tracked using the `query_status` response field.

parameters.name: project_short_id
parameters.description: The short identifier for the project within Datadog. Used to specify which project's insights to retrieve.

parameters.name: return_basic_metadata_only
parameters.description: If true, return only basic insight metadata without results for a faster response.

value_schema.description: Return basic insight metadata only (no results, faster).

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the PostHog API.

parameters.name: basic
parameters.description: Return basic insight metadata only (no results, faster).

value_schema.description: Return basic insight metadata only (no results, faster).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

value_schema.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

value_schema.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

parameters.name: refresh
parameters.description:
Whether to refresh the retrieved insights, how aggresively, and if sync or async:
- `'force_cache'` - return cached data or a cache miss; always completes immediately as it never calculates
- `'blocking'` - calculate synchronously (returning only when the query is done), UNLESS there are very fresh results in the cache
- `'async'` - kick off background calculation (returning immediately with a query status), UNLESS there are very fresh results in the cache
- `'lazy_async'` - kick off background calculation, UNLESS there are somewhat fresh results in the cache
- `'force_blocking'` - calculate synchronously, even if fresh results are already cached
- `'force_async'` - kick off background calculation, even if fresh results are already cached
Background calculation can be tracked using the `query_status` response field.

value_schema.description:

- `'force_cache'` - return cached data or a cache miss; always completes immediately as it never calculates
